options.label: Just keep talking after the time is finished
Skip the last main point and move on to the conclusion

data.stimulus: What do you think you should do if you are running out of time?

In your live lessons, you have considered the FOUR parts of a conclusion.

► What are they?

options.label: You ask the audience if they have any questions.
You inform the audience you are going to finish.
You tell the audience the most important point of ALL the presentation

data.stimulus:
The first part of the conclusion is the SIGNAL.

 

►What happens in this part?

Here are some useful signposting phrases for this part.

Organise the words into a correct sentence.

options.label: You ask the audience if they have any questions.
You inform the audience you are going to finish.
You tell the audience the most important point of ALL the presentation

data.stimulus:
The second part of the conclusion is the SUMMARY.

 

►What happens in this part?

Here are some useful signposting phrases for this part.

Organise the words into a correct sentence.

First, let's consider the GRAMMAR used in this section.

► Choose the correct option from the drop down.
data.template:
• I {{response}} my presentation with an analysis of…
  • We {{response}} that…
  • Then, I {{response}}  the importance of…
  • After that, I {{response}} the benefits of….
  • In the final part of the presentation, I {{response}} about…

value: In the beginning of my presentation
I have considered how we can expand to Europe
Next, I have evaluated the most
suitable marketing tools for this purpose
The final part of my presentation was
about the best areas for our premises

data.stimulus:
And now, let's focus on the CONTENT. 

► As we have mentioned in the presentation above, the content of this section is similar to the overview, but you should NOT use the same words - you should PARAPHRASE!

 

 

Here are some phrases from the Overview and the Summary. 

► Choose the best way to paraphrase each of the points.
data.template:
Example 1: 

► Overview: In the first part of my presentation, I will focus on the expansion of our business to the European market.
► Summary: {{response}}, {{response}}.

Example 2:  

► Overview: Then, in the second part, I'm going to analyse the best international marketing tools.
► Summary: {{response}} {{response}}.

Example 3: 

► Overview: After that, I’d like to propose some recruitment options for our new workforce.
► Summary: {{response}} {{response}}.

Example 4:

► Overview: And to finish off, I’ll be looking at strategic locations for our new offices.
► Summary: {{response}} {{response}}.

value: In the beginning of my presentation
I have considered how we can expand to Europe
Next, I have evaluated the most
suitable marketing tools for this purpose
The final part of my presentation was
about the best areas for our premises

options.label: You ask the audience if they have any questions.
You inform the audience you are going to finish.
You tell the audience the most important point of ALL the presentation

data.stimulus:
The third part of the conclusion is the CONCLUSION.

 

►What happens in this part?

You must decide for yourself what the most important point is, based on your presentation.

 

► Some ADVICE for this section:
data.template:
• Give your {{response}} on the topic.
  • Make a {{response}}.
  • {{response}} sentences will be enough for this.
  • Speak {{response}}, use {{response}} phrases and {{response}} key words.

options.label: You ask the audience if they have any questions.
You inform the audience you are going to finish.
You tell the audience the most important point of ALL the presentation

data.stimulus:
The final part of the conclusion is the CLOSING REMARKS.

 

►What happens in this part?

Here are some useful signposting phrases for this part.

► Organise the words into a correct sentence.
